summary:
• A Kenya-led security force has arrived in Haiti after receiving UN approval.
• The arrival marks an effort to improve security conditions in the country.
• The security force aims to stabilize the situation in Haiti under the guidance of the United Nations.

• Aer Lingus pilots have begun taking industrial action due to a pay dispute.
• The strike is in response to disagreements over salaries with airline management.
• This development may lead to disruptions in flight schedules, causing inconvenience to passengers.

• The Israeli Supreme Court has ruled that all ultra-Orthodox students must be drafted to serve in the military.
• Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has rejected a ceasefire proposal, causing outrage among hostages' families.
• A recent ruling by the Israeli Supreme Court requires ultra-Orthodox students to join the military.

• Julian Assange pleaded guilty to an unspecified charge in US court.
• A partial gag order in a Trump-related case was lifted by a NY judge.
• Volkswagen will invest up to $5 billion in Tesla rival Rivian.
